title: Dr. Salim Ahmed Salim - Tanzanian Politician &â€¦ | Salim Ahmed Salim

quotes: Dr. Salim Ahmed Salim was born on 23 January 1942 at the Mwembeladu hospital in Unguja
Dr. Salim attended Uweleni Primary School in Mkoani from 1948 to 1956.

In 1957 Dr. Salim was among three students from the entire island of Pemba to be selected from the Standard 8 class in the province to pursue secondary education at the Government Boys' Secondary School
Dr. Salim stayed at the school for one year, after which he attended King George VI Secondary School (later named Lumumba College) until 1960.

quotes: He joined the Scouts movement in Standard 6, where he was introduced to essential life skills, learning specifically service to the community.

supporting_quotes: Dr. Salim attended Uweleni Primary School in Mkoani from 1948 to 1956.

In 1957 Dr. Salim was among three students from the entire island of Pemba to be selected from the Standard 8 class in the province to pursue secondary education at the Government Boys' Secondary School (now known as Ben Bella Secondary) on the main island of Unguja.
Dr. Salim stayed at the school for one year, after which he attended King George VI Secondary School (later named Lumumba College) until 1960.
In his second year in secondary school, Dr. Salim, along with his fellow students, started a student organisation called the All Zanzibar Students' Union,
